intro: Cousinia maracandica, commonly known as the Kashmir stonecress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant features basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers in early summer. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand cold and drought conditions. Cousinia maracandica is often used in traditional medicine and has ornamental value due to its hardy nature and attractive foliage.
